attributes.action: Cut Masters Level University Student Tuition Fees by at least 50%
attributes.additional_details: It is appalling to see the lack of support offered by our Government to University students from both 2019/20 and 2020/21 cohorts. As a collective community, we ask, how can this Government justify the costs of a Masters degree, which is anywhere between £5,000-£25,000, in a pandemic whereby students are paying for inadequate video calls and PowerPoint presentations. Our education matters. University qualifications count. However, these costs simply are not reflective of the services provided.
attributes.background: Following the emphasis placed on the education of primary and secondary school children due to the damaging effects of COVID-19, it is crucial that the Government takes a long hard look at the United Kingdoms university system, which has arguably been impacted in even more ways.

rejection.details:
Decisions about fees for postgraduate degrees are a matter for individual universities, not the Government or House of Commons.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Introduce a One-Off Postgraduate Study Grant: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/330806

Government subsidise this year's university tuition fees: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/552814

Require universities to partially refund tuition fees for 20/21 due to Covid-19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/324762
